Module fraus.javaproject
Package fraus.javaproject.api

Class Client

java.lang.Object
fraus.javaproject.api.Client
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object

This class is utilized BUILDER pattern to create communication channel to web-server using JSON ,accepting 4 important methods GET, POST, PUT, DELETE request methods.

Version:
1.0.2
Author:
Dang Khoa Nguyen

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client​(java.lang.String route)

      Select which route connects to server.

      Parameters:
      route - as route, may be the database's name.

  • Method Details

    • setMethod

      public Client setMethod​(java.lang.String requestMethod)

      Attach the request method to send Accept 4 request's methods including: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE

      Example: setMethod("GET")
      Parameters:
      requestMethod - as String to set the request method.
      Returns:
      this

    • setParams

      public Client setParams​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> params)

      Attach which params to send to server
      If you use GET method, you don't need to set params

      Parameters:
      params - as HashMap
      Returns:
      this to change the next options

    • sendRequest

      public Client sendRequest()

      Send built request to back-end server.

      Returns:
      this to complete the request and send to web-server, then return the next chain for mapping purpose

    • mappingTo

      public <T> T mappingTo​(java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)

      Mapping the response from server to as a List.

      Parameters:
      typeOfT - type of the class included in List
      Returns:
      as List

    • mappingTo

      public <T> T mappingTo​(java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)

      Mapping the response from server to as a class.

      Parameters:
      classOfT - type of the class
      Returns:
      as List
